result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Maurice M Gaillard

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Maurice M Gaillard not in court, in custody.  Attorney Russell J. A. Jones appeared by video for Maurice M Gaillard.  Attorney Francesco Mineo appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Status hearing. Discussion placed on the record. Defense requested Final PreTrial and Jury Trial dates. State advised the Court of possible Joinder Motion. Court ordered parties to submit their Motions in Limine, Jury Instructions, and Witness Lists by the Final PreTrial date. Any Motions are due one week before Final PreTrial date. Court ordered State to file Joinder Motion by December 22, 2022. Defense response is due by January 5, 2023. Court ordered case adjourned for Final PreTrial and Jury Trial. Case remains calendared in Branch 16. 

Final PreTrial scheduled for January 12, 2023 at 2:00 pm. Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference. Hearing will be held in Room 503 of the Courthouse. 
Jury Trial scheduled for February 6, 2022 at 09:00 am. Trial will be held in Room 503 of the Courthouse.

Attorney Russell J. A. Jones is in trial on another matter and will be unavailable for today's scheduling conference. Case remains calendared for a Status Conference for September 26, 2022 at 8:30 am; both parties agreed to date and time, via email.

Email correspondence with parties. Attorney Jones informs court that he is in trial on another matter and will be unavailable for 09/09/2022 hearing. Case re-scheduled for a Status Conference on 09/26/2022 at 08:30 am, Br 16.

Defendant Sir Bishup Pirtle appeared by video.  Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask appeared by video for Sir Bishup Pirtle.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 16, Judge Grayson. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 16.
Scheduling conference scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Russell J. A. Jones in court, defendant Maurice M Gaillard not in court, in custody.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a scheduling conference.  Defendant has another pending matter in Branch 28 (21CF2744).  Defense informs the court of a possible global offer.  Court authorizes transfer of case to Branch 28.  Court also accepts transfer of case from Branch 28. Court scheduled a status conference to be held via Zoom.  Case adjourned to Branch 16, Rm 503 CH.  Status conference scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. MOTION TO REVIEW DIGITAL DISCOVERY IN THE JAIL

Defendant Maurice M Gaillard in court with Attorney Russell J. A. Jones.  Defendant Maurice M Gaillard in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded. Stipulation to the identification of the defendant agreed upon by the parties and approved by the court. Sworn for the State: MPD Detective M. Slomczewski.   Court took judicial notice of 18CF3274. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Notice of Retainer

Adjustment Number: 22A 053731,
Payable Number: 1011924,
Receipt Number: 22RP023193,
Amount: $20.00

Court ordered no contact with Denise B. & co-def: Sir Pirtle
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Maurice M Gaillard in court with attorney Russell J. A. Jones.  Defendant Maurice M Gaillard in custody.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Maurice M Gaillard appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defense request to be heard on bail at the preliminary hearing.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
